page.title: 03SOMERFORD COMMON FOX HUNTING
page.content: Somerford Common is part of what was originally a large forest, Braydon Forest. In the past the hunting was for deer, but now it is for foxes. The dense undergrowth, though, does not make it a good fox hunting area. The hounds waste a lot of time and energy with few results, and the wet, heavy going causes injury to the horses. The Hunt is not popular with the local farmers as damage is caused to the heavy ground by the hounds and horses when the Hunt go over the farmland. Farmers do not care for the attitude taken by the Hunt as they ride wherever they like, irrespective of who owns the land.
